10:04 <philipp\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <philipp\_> Hi, I am having a problem with the WYSIWYG editor. When I create a bullet list and delete an item the view jumps back to the beginning of the document  
10:07 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <florinciu> has quit  
10:56 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <sburjan> Hello. I have a question. It seems that when I want to see the RSS feed from my watchlist on Chrome, I get a download window. Is this normal ? I don't get this in Firefox  
11:00 <sburjan> I am prompted to save a file named WatchlistRSS with no extension.  
11:00 <sburjan> the URL is /xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WatchListRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain  
11:00 <sburjan> is this normal ?  
11:01 <tmortagne> sburjan: does not sounds normal, there is probably a content type issue  
11:02 <sburjan> I remember that on Chrome I was getting a plain text page, because Chrome does not have any RSS reader integrated as Firefox. But getting a download prompt is odd.  
11:02 <sburjan> tmortagne: thanks, I will report it  
11:04 <tmortagne> sburjan: do you have the same issue with blog rss or other XWiki rss pages ?  
11:04 <sburjan> tmortagne: no. The Blog RSS and Dashboard RSS renders as plain text, no download window  
11:05 <tmortagne> I get plain text on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain using chrome and indeed it tried to download on /xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WatchListRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain  
11:05 <sburjan> so this is ok. But watchlist RSS prompts me to download  
11:05 <sburjan> so it should be reported, right ?  
11:05 <tmortagne> so at least there is something special about the watchlist  
11:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: it should be the same behavior whatever is the right one

11:55 <philipp\_> Hi, I am having a problem with the WYSIWYG editor. When I create a bullet list and delete an item the view jumps back to the beginning of the document  
11:55 <cjd> Good morning, that sounds like a bug to me.  
11:55 <philipp\_> Is this a bug? How can I fix it?  
11:56 <cjd> You could search jira.xwiki.org and see if it's happening to anyone else and report it (make sure to include browser type and version)  
11:56 <philipp\_> thanks, I will have a look  
11:56 <cjd> If you're adventrous, you could look at the source, it's GWT Java-->Javascript code  
11:59 <philipp\_> cjd: That would be the xwiki-enterprise repo, right?  
12:00 <cjd> platform  
12:00 <cjd> there should be a subcomponent called WYSIWYG  
12:03 <philipp\_> cjd: thanks  
12:03 <cjd> Thank you  
12:42 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:04 <vmassol> guys, tomorrow is 4.3RC1 right?  
13:04 <vmassol> Enygma`: are you done with the M2 release? will you be able to finish it today?  
13:38 <Enygma`> vmassol: finishing today  
13:40 <jvelo> is 4.3RC1 maintained for tomorrow in that light ?  
13:40 <jvelo> \  
14:04 <vmassol> jvelo: I doubt it… wdyt?  
14:05 <jvelo> just so I know and make sure I make time on the due date :)  
14:05 <vmassol> end of week sounds more likely IMO but it would be really be good if you could start the release process Thursday so that it gets released on Friday  
14:05 <vmassol> wdyt?  
14:05 <jvelo> but if it's later than tomorrow It's actually fine  
14:05 <jvelo> ok  
14:05 <vmassol> you could send yet another new date proposal....  
14:05 <vmassol> :)  
14:06 <jvelo> is that really necessary ?  
14:07 <vmassol> you could mention that devs should stop adding new stuff on Thursday EOD  
14:07 <vmassol> well your choice  
14:07 <vmassol> but you need to gather all devs  
14:07 <vmassol> ATM  
14:07 <jvelo> ok  
14:07 <vmassol> everyone is on 14th  
14:07 <vmassol> and beyond that date without any new date  
14:07 <vmassol> it's going to be a mess  
14:07 <vmassol> the roadmap page will need to be modified with the new date when agreed  
14:07 <vmassol> http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap  
14:08 <vmassol> I personally won't be available starting tomorrow early  
14:08 <vmassol> since I'd be in the train to Devoxx  
14:08 <vmassol> till Friday  
14:09 <jvelo> you'll be in the train till friday ?  
14:09 <jvelo> hope not for you  
14:09 <jvelo> :)  
14:09 <jvelo> ok  
14:10 <jvelo> I'll send a mail this afternoon then  
14:16 <vmassol> jvelo: I hope not ;)  
14:16 <vmassol> although there are strikes on the belgian RATP tomorrow...  
14:17 <jvelo> it's refreshing to see those exists outside France  
14:19 <vmassol> :)  
14:19 <vmassol> Belgian has had someone governing the country for a long time… is that another similarity? :)

14:22 <Michitux> has joined #xwiki

14:38 <Inge-> anyone tried to do a wget of an xwiki site?  
14:41 <vmassol> Inge-: there's also the HTML export ;)  
14:41 <vmassol> (no I haven't tried a wget)  
14:42 <Inge-> good point.  
14:43 <Inge-> Is the HTML export intended to also work as a static version of the site?  
14:43 <Inge-> Or is the use case a different one?  
14:45 <vmassol> static version  
14:49 <vmassol> mflorea: any update for the LT in guest mode for the user picker? Note that it's not critical for my demo in the end (since I'm not going to show a guest user after all) but you have it ready in not long I can use it, otherwise I need to start stabilizing my version of XE :)  
14:49 <vmassol> s/but you/but if you  
14:54 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't have it yet because I worked on other things..  
14:54 <vmassol> ok np  
14:54 <vmassol> glad I didn't need it in the end :)  
14:55 <mflorea> ok, sorry, I'm going to fix it for 4.3RC1 though  
14:55 <vmassol> ok  
15:02 <vmassol> reminder to self:  check JCR-JQOM (JCR Java Query Object Model) from JCR 2.0  
15:02 <vmassol> (which expresses a query as a tree of Java objects. )  
15:07 <crocket> has joined #xwiki  
15:08 <crocket> Where can I learn XWQL object model?  
15:16 <vmassol> crocket: see above ^^  
15:17 <crocket> vmassol, I need not only XWQL grammar but also its object model reference.  
15:17 <crocket> Something like DOM.  
15:19 <crocket> The examples don't look thorough.  
15:19 <vmassol> xwiki-platform-query-xwql module  
15:25 <vmassol> tmortagne: synchronizing with the repository app takes a lot of time on e.x.o. I've clicked more than 30 seconds ago and still working…  
15:25 <vmassol> (doing it for "Extension Repository Application" ATM)  
15:26 <sburjan> tmortagne: replied to XWIKI-8328  
15:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: can take some time if there is a lot of versions I guess but "Extension Repository Application" does not have a lot of them so it sounds weird  
15:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: been 3 minutes already, still waiting  
15:27 <philipp\_> has quit  
15:28 <vmassol> I've noticed in the past that it was long but not that long...  
15:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's maybe not slow then but stuck or something  
15:28 <vmassol> I'll wait some more  
15:28 <vmassol> done  
15:28 <vmassol> wow took 3 minutes  
15:29 <vmassol> hmm I wanted to have 4.3M2  
15:29 <vmassol> we don't do milestones?  
15:30 <tmortagne> not by default no  
15:30 <vmassol> ah ok, I didn't remember that  
15:32 <vmassol> ok  
15:36 <crocket> vmassol, I've not been successful in finding xwiki-platform-query-xwql  
15:38 <Enygma`> vmassol: your commit seems to generate a clirr error that shows up only(?) when I generate the clirr report  
15:38 <Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/a676888a9a77eacb525ccede05851382ae4b7892  
15:38 <Enygma`> com.xpn.xwiki.tool.backup.ImportMojo: Field MPNAME\_DESCRIPTION has been removed, but it was previously a constant  
15:39 <Enygma`> should we care about it?  
15:40 <Enygma`> please add a description or remove the last lines on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki43M2#HAPIBreakages  
15:40 <vmassol> it's a breakage  
15:40 <vmassol> even though not an important one, so it should be in the list  
15:40 <vmassol> we shoudl get a clirr error all the time  
15:40 <Enygma`> so it just needs a description  
15:40 <vmassol> t's in the CLIRR exclude list?  
15:40 <vmassol> it's not  
15:40 <vmassol> ?  
15:41 <Enygma`> no, it is not  
15:41 <vmassol> hmm then that's why I didn't put it  
15:41 <Enygma`> it's on the release notes only (added by me)  
15:41 <vmassol> because clirr didn't reort it  
15:41 <vmassol> report  
15:41 <vmassol> we'd need to understand why  
15:41 <vmassol> it looks like it should always be reported as a breakage  
15:41 <Enygma`> but clirr reports it when I explicitly generate the report... so yes, something weird is going on  
15:42 <vmassol> the message should be "Unused field"  
15:43 <mflorea> has quit  
15:48 <Enygma`> ok, I`ve updated it.  
15:48 <Enygma`> (release notes)  
15:49 <crocket> Enygma`, Is Document the only accessible object in a Query Module? If it wasn't, where could I find the rest of the Query Module objects?  
15:57 <sburjan> !seen Denis  
15:59 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
16:00 <mflorea> vmassol: what's the issue with AWM Share extension?  
16:00 <vmassol> mflorea: thanks  
16:00 <Enygma`> crocket: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module  
16:00 <vmassol> it seems it's not working anymore  
16:00 <vmassol> it used to pop up a dialog box  
16:01 <vmassol> but now it goes to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/AppWithinMinutes/ManageUserRepositories  
16:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: would be great if you could hide technical documetns in the extension repo app  
16:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok, reviewing them  
16:40 <vmassol> actually there'e only 1 to hide  
16:40 <vmassol> RepositoryConfig.xml  
16:41 <tmortagne> that one is generated actually  
16:41 <tmortagne> that's probably why  
16:41 <vmassol> ok then we need to fix the generation I guess  
16:41 <vmassol> I think I already made the other ones hidden indeed  
16:41 <tmortagne> yes, the generation code is older than hidden stuff  
16:42 <tmortagne> looking at it  
17:02 <sburjan> has quit  
17:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: I get several exceptions in my console when using the EM and repository app  
17:05 <vmassol> although everything seems to work fine  
17:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: 4.3 snapshot ?  
17:06 <vmassol> 4.3M2  
17:06 <vmassol> for ex: https://gist.github.com/4066629  
17:07 <tmortagne> vmassol: would be nice if you could report this on jira, looks like a serious thing, maybe caused by the recent modifications on REST  
17:08 <vmassol> ok, I'll need to understand what action I do cause this  
17:08 <vmassol> on a different topic, this could be interesting for us to use: https://github.com/FluentLenium/FluentLenium  
17:08 <tmortagne> you don't have the associated URL in the log ?  
17:08 <tmortagne> REST service maybe does not have the URL actually  
17:09 <vmassol> nope  
17:09 <vmassol> that's a pain btw  
17:09 <tmortagne> yep  
17:09 <tmortagne> it's probably easy to fix where we initialize the context for the REST service  
17:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok I have reproduced. I just need to go to the home of the repo app  
17:10 <vmassol> but maybeit's caused by some extension I had and that I have removed  
17:10 <tmortagne> ok so it's the search service  
17:10 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
17:10 <tmortagne> to the repo app ?  
17:10 <vmassol> because I don't remember seeing this when I had no extension  
17:10 <tmortagne> I don't understand  
17:10 <vmassol> extension repository app  
17:10 <tmortagne> repository app does not do any REST request  
17:10 <tmortagne> EM does  
17:10 <vmassol> this page: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WebHome  
17:11 <vmassol> wait  
17:11 <vmassol> I actually get the exception continuously  
17:11 <vmassol> every 2 seconds  
17:11 <vmassol> without doing anything  
17:11 <vmassol> :)  
17:11 <tmortagne> without any page open ?  
17:11 <vmassol> without calling any page yes  
17:12 <tmortagne> but do you have some page open that may have some ajax call every 2 seconds  
17:12 <tmortagne> like the EM UI I think when you look at an extension details  
17:12 <vmassol> just the repo web home page  
17:12 <vmassol> that's the only one open  
17:12 <tmortagne> ok, weird  
17:13 <vmassol> I'm not sre how to report hits….  
17:13 <tmortagne> anyway I won't be able to look at this today, if you could create a jira issue about it so that i don't forget to look at it that would be nice  
17:14 <vmassol> crezting  
17:14 <vmassol> hopefully it won't crash on me during my demo of tomorrow  
17:15 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8436  
17:17 <tmortagne> thanks  
17:17 <tmortagne> has quit

21:04 <mflorea> has quit  
21:10 <coud> hi, I'm trying to use XWQL with REST API. Simple queries work but for example this from Query Module doesn't: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/rest/wikis/xwiki/query?q=from doc.object(XWiki.XWikiUsers) as user&type=xwql  
21:10 <coud> It gives me this exception:  
21:10 <coud> [1,91] expecting: EOF  
21:10 <coud> what am I doing wrong ?  
21:11 <sdumitriu> Why do you have "from" two times?  
21:18 <coud> I see only one "from" written in query. Does the second one is infered from some part of the query ?  
21:19 <coud> ah, I see - in translated query
